fields.description: Especially now that self registration is implemented, users need a way to reset their own password. Currently one must hassle an administrator.
fields.summary: Reset password for built-in users

fields.description:
Please would you review the FishEye docs on CAC:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE/FishEye+Documentation+Home

Here's what I've done:
* Restructured the docs quite a bit, especially the Admin Guide.
* Added screenshots.
* Added quite a few instructions on how to get to a particular screen/page.
* Tidied up the language a bit here and there.
* Included an index, via labels.
* Added JIRA issues for longer-term tasks: http://jira.atlassian.com/secure/IssueNavigator.jspa?reset=true&mode=hide&pid=11830&sorter/order=DESC&sorter/field=priority&resolution=-1&component=12251

Deadline:
We want to 'unhide' the space asap, i.e. make the new docs visible to all our customers and hide the Cenqua docs. So please would you give this review top priority.
fields.summary: Review FishEye docs on CAC

fields.description: Once the review of the new FishEye docs is complete, export the XML, PDF and HTML versions and upload to ALLDOCS space.
fields.summary: Export the XML, PDF and HTML versions and upload to ALLDOCS space

Also impacts the up coming crucible api

I tried to add something but couldn't quite come up with an expression for what it does.
fields.summary: Document "File History View Mode"

fields.summary: Incorrect spelling 'Seach' on Simple Search screen

fields.description: Fisheye needs a SOAP/XML-RPC interface for its administrative functions.  DevSuite needs to be able to create and customize repositories as well as set general admin settings remotely.
fields.summary: Fisheye needs an administrative remote API

fields.description: We need a crowd connector for fisheye that fully supports crowd features, including single sign-on.
fields.summary: Fisheye needs to support Crowd SSO

fields.description:
Currently they link to the annotated view at the given revision number. For instance, the highlighted link in the attached screenshot links here:

https://svn.atlassian.com/privateeye/browse/private/atlassian/confluence/trunk/confluence/src/webapp/template/includes/macros.vm?r=24675#l381

I always click on this link to see the comment associated with the change and the other changes in the changeset. That is, this link should go to changeset page:

https://svn.atlassian.com/privateeye/changelog/private?cs=24675

If this isn't possible for some repository types, a suitable alternative is the revision in the change history of the given file:

https://svn.atlassian.com/privateeye/browse/private/atlassian/confluence/trunk/confluence/src/webapp/template/includes/macros.vm#r24675

Please explain if there's a compelling reason for linking to a particular revision of the annotated view; this seems fairly useless to me.
fields.summary: On annotated code view, line changeset numbers should link to changeset

fields.description:
Currently when a rescan of the revision properties for a revision range is pending, no other rescans can be done.
This makes it difficult to use fisheyectl in the post-revprop-change hook script for SVN since all rescans after the first will fail.
fields.summary: Allow for multiple revision rescans to be pending

fields.description: allow Subversion property values to be queried using EyeQL
fields.summary: Allow SVN Properties to be queried in eyeQL

fields.description: You can customize the welcome box and support box on the fisheye/cru homepage via the config.xml. However no documentation exists for this feature so nobody knows about it (save a few that have been informed via support). FE-62 will add admin interface screens for this feature as well.
fields.summary: Document custom content capability

fields.description: There is a little known feature in FishEye that enables you to replace the welcome message, support message, and footer (i think) by adding some elements to the config.xml. One should be able to edit these via the admin web interface. In the first instance a simple unvalidated text area should suffice.
fields.summary: Admin screens for custom homepage and footer content

fields.description: Allow to use it as a real public forge.
fields.summary: Ability to customize Fisheye welcome message

fields.description:
The link can be used to point to a Confluence workspace.
Description is already provided but not show anywhere.
fields.summary: Display link and description from root Fisheye page
RESTful admin api
Add 'reindex repository' command to FishEyeCtl interface

fields.description:
When creating archives from FishEye (tar, zip, etc), it can take a while for the archive to be produced as FishEye has to fetch content from the underlying SCM system. 
if the user navigates away from the page before the archive is streamed, there is likely to be an EOF or broken pipe exception on the FishEye log.

There are a few possible ways to handle this
Build archives off line
Give indication of archive progress.
fields.summary: Give indication of archive creation progress

fields.description:
When I navigate to:

https://svn.atlassian.com/privateeye/browse/private/atlassian/bamboo/tags/atlassian-bamboo-1.2.2/bamboo-web-app/src/main/webapp/lib/ui.ftl

Fisheye displays an empty history.  See the attached screenshot.
fields.summary: File has empty history in FishEye

fields.description:
The new diff colours introduced in 1.3.5 (cru 1.1) are too dark, especially in crucible.  The ediff looks ok, but the standard diff gets a bit much especially when there are large blocks of change.

In Crucible it can even make the comments hard to see. I know colourblind matt likes them, but for the standard punter it makes the page look so busy it is hard to focus.  Matt suggested a strong/light colour pref? That is pretty easy to do, but I think the default should be a more visually appealing version.
fields.summary: Diff colours too dark & noisy

fields.description:
should return a list of tags for a revision.

Also consider a listTagsForRevisions() which takes a list of revisions to inspect (to avoid chatty communication)
fields.summary: add listTagsForRevision() to remote api

fields.description:
If you also have [Crucible|http://www.atlassian.com/software/crucible], you could search for all code that hasn't yet been reviewed. 

(probably Crucible 1.2 / FishEye 1.4 )
fields.summary: add to 'Search' page in new FishEye Feature Tour, after implemented in Crucible

fields.description:
The diff display in FE currently just highlights the added/removed lines plus "ediff" highlighting within changed chunks.

We should additionally synhi the whole file. The diff/ediff highlighting should take precedence over the synhi highlighting (esp background colours, and foreground?) but bold/itallic could probably shine through?
fields.summary: Syntax highlight in diff display

fields.description: A lot of Perforce users use branches without declaring them using the p4 branch command. A symbolic setup in FishEye to declare branch patterns could be used to augment the repository branch management
fields.summary: Support symbolic paths for Perforce repositories

fields.description:
The SVN repository updater allows for specifying a poll period which means trying to find a balance between polling too frequently and ensuring the updates are there when the user expects them.

I have a number of respositories which are effectively dormant and looked at once a week or once a month. I'd like the ability when viewing a repository to request an immediate poll to check FishEye is in sync with the latest repository data. The configuration page could provide the minimum time between user initiated poll requests to ensure repeated overlaps don't happen.

In that model, I'd do away with configuring the constant unnecessary polling and and link the FishEye refresh with my updates.
fields.summary: Ability to request a repository update on demand

fields.description:
Use case:

Something broke in a particular file, I want to find out what's changed and why.  I don't know when the change occurred, it could have been anytime since the last branch.

I view a diff of the file, from the branch point to the head of trunk.  I browse through all the changes, until I find the one that I believe is responsible for the problem.  I want to find out who the committer is, and why they made this change, but the diff view doesn't provide a way to navigate to the commit, or even to discover the revision number in which the change was made.
fields.summary: Ability to navigate from specific a line in a diff, to the commit in which that line changed

fields.description:
add coldfusion/ruby ala https://support.atlassian.com/browse/CRC-46

look in FISHEYE_INST for syntaxdef too
fields.summary: Syntaxdef improvements

The UI for diffs in 1.3.5 is a big step down from prior versions.  It's bulky and blocky and doesn't flow as nicely as it did before.  The responses on the team have been pretty negative about it.

(This includes the UI in Crucible's diffs.)
fields.summary: New Diff UI (in 1.3.5) Is A Step Down
apply new left-nav to Bamboo and Clover spaces

fields.description:
Change the URLs on the FishEye Admin screens to point to the new doc pages on CAC.

* Use permanent URLs (i.e. perm links, not links based on page names, which may change).
* Implement a single file containing the help links (as is done for JIRA) - better for maintainability and versioning.
* Maybe we can host the help-links file on Atlassian servers by default, instead of shipping it with the product? So the code would have to say something like:
** Look for my help-links file locally.
** If not found, look for my help-links file on Atlassian servers.
** Having found my help-links file, look to see if there is a help link for my field (e.g. by field ID).
** If no help link found, do not display help icon.
** If help link found, collect the corresponding URL and display the help icon.

This way, we can dynamically add the help links as we build the documentation pages. And we can also allow our customers to supply their own help-links file e.g. if they have downloaded our docs and installed the docs on their own Confluence server (e.g. within a firewall).

NOTE: At each major product release (1.1, 1.2, etc), the doc space on CAC is archived. The online help links will need to take the archiving process into account, because URLs will change.
fields.summary: Point online help links to new FishEye doc space

fields.description:
Make the FishEye User Guide more comprehensive:
* Add 'how to' sections as in user guides of other products.
* Reorganise and polish what is already there e.g. split long pages into shorter logical units.
* Include overviews and scenarios.
* More graphical - add screenshots etc.
* New content will at least double the size of what is there. Large job. (This approximation will be used for time estimates.)
* Additional content on website could be added to docs and tweaked too e.g. Advanced Searching; RSS and watching; annotations.

To consider:
* Once the user guide is enhanced, should we remove the online demo (http://www.cenqua.com/fisheye/demo/tour/ )? If yes, create a separate JIRA issue for the dev team to remove the code.
fields.summary: FishEye User Guide

fields.description: Talk to the FishEye dev team and bring the installation guide up to date.
fields.summary: FishEye installation guide

fields.description:
Left-hand nav panel needs adaptation to Confluence 2.6 styles.

This affects all the documentation spaces on CAC. Using FISHEYE space as the first candidate.

From Sarah on Friday 14 Sep 07:
>
> I've been having a bit of trouble getting italic text to show in the FishEye space. It turns out to be caused by the styles used in the Page Layout. Root cause is that we are using the <blockquote> style to draw the line between the TOC and the main body.
>
> So instead I've tried the layout suggested here:
> http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DEMOS/Customizing+Layout+-+Left-hand+Navigation
>
> I've adapted it a bit:
> * Removed the live search (because we are using the pagetree search)
> * Changed the TOC text size to normal (the above layout sets it to small text)
>

Also adapted the background colour of the TOC, to make it stand out from the rest of the page, because we've lost the line between the panels. I've tried to choose a colour which will not clash with our notes, warnings, panels etc.

To do:
* Finalise format on the FISHEYE space and get agreement from teams.
* Apply to other documentation spaces on CAC.
fields.summary: Left-hand nav panel needs adaptation to Confluence 2.6 styles

After Fisheye forums are moved, update all links in docs

fields.description:
The FishEye API doesn't currently expose P4 job information via their remote API, either through EyeQL or otherwise.

However, FishEye does currently index P4 job names.

This feature request entails that:

   1. P4 job names are exposed via EyeQL (both as a where clause for text searches and as a return clause)
   2. P4 job info is indexed by FishEye and exposed via EyeQL in a similar fashion

This issue is derived from an [issue raised against the JIRA FishEye plugin|http://developer.atlassian.com/jira/browse/FISH-57].
fields.summary: Index & expose P4 job information via remote API

fields.description:
Back in 2004 Cenqua announced (see http://www.cenqua.com/forums/thread.jspa?threadID=933 )  that  "... We definitely have plans to improve FishEye's server-friendly-ness (start/stop scripts, etc). ... We are looking to implement such functionality in the next beta (0.4) or the one after ..."!

I do understand that the Java Wrapper software from Tanuki Software (http://wrapper.tanukisoftware.org ) works very well - we can find quite useful hints that do work in the above mentioned forum thread. I assume that most of the FishEye enterprise customers use this software w/o problems (can not imagine that in serious enterprise installations FishEye is started manually from the command line), so from that perspective all is OK.

Nevertheless I am raising a "New Feature" Issue with critical priority for the following reason:
I expect from Atlassian to support OFFICIALLY the "Service Wrapper" startup fro FishEye.

I do not know if Atlassian-Cenqua should reinvent the wheel and write the equivalent code again (licensing?), but my expectation is that this feature will become part of the official distribution very soon / the advices in forums are nice and do work, but for a commercial application we need the official support guarantee :)
fields.summary: FishEye Startup - Implement/Support Java Service Wrapper (Windows Service or Unix Daemon)

fields.description:
My company is IBM iSeries and mainframe shop, the column filter is required to filter columns in source code with auxiliary data (sequence numbers, modifications dates) updated automatically on the platforms mentioned.

In the example below...This is how code would look like after import from iSeries to PC. If I insert just one line, the sequence numbers at the left for all the records below inserted line would change. So positions 1-12 need to be ignored in a compare..
-------------------------------------------
006100980615
006200980615#include <stdio.h>
006300980615#include <stdlib.h>
006400980706#include <string.h>
006500980616#include <decimal.h>
006600000301#include "db.h"
006700980623
-------------------------------------------
fields.summary: column (or regex) diff filtering

fields.description:
It would be very nice to be able to NOT have to have FishEye run in its own JVM.  Ideally, it would be great to be able to run FishEye in the same JVM as my JIRA and Confluence.  This means the ability to DISABLE the stand-alone server mode, and run inside tomcat.

Each JVM takes considerable memory for each JVM.  On my amd64 box, the FishEye JVM is taking 168mb memory (resident).  Most of this is not FishEye, but the JVM overhead itself.  If I could run this inside an existing JVM, I could cut down on the number of JVM's running, and thus memory usage.  Additionally, I could then access this via. tomcat's AJP 1.3 interface, and use mod_jk to access this from Apache, like I do the other Atlassian products.
fields.summary: Allow FishEye to run inside Tomcat

fields.description:
We have some directories with long path names, or several sub directories that contain only one thing so FishEye puts more of the path (i.e. Folder/sub/src/com/blah) in the folder view.

In IE, it appears FishEye handles this ok, or at least to the best of its ability. But in Firefox, it pushes the entire path down to the next line, which is not indented the same as the above directory arrow and it looks very odd.

See attached screenshots.
fields.summary: Long path names wrapping oddly in folder view listing

fields.description:
FishEye only considers filetypes of "text" as text.
http://www.perforce.com/perforce/doc.072/manuals/cmdref/o.ftypes.html#1040647
http://www.perforce.com/perforce/doc.072/user/i18nnotes.txt

We should take into consideration "unicode" and "utf16" as well.
fields.summary: [P4] need to consider "utf8" etc file types

fields.description: After upgading from 1.3beta to 1.3.5 I get the attached error when I try to access Fisheye.
fields.summary: Stack overflow when trying to log in

fields.description: I browse some directory (screen shot 1), filter by author (screen shot 2) and then hit "show/hide empty" (screen shot 3). You'll notice that gruden2\judy is now gruden2%5Cjudy - this is != to the intended user filter and until this constraint is removed all commits will be hidden.
fields.summary: Show Empty / Filter by Author - double encoding of \

fields.description:
I installed latest Crucible and fisheye.access = md5:... appeared to public frontend

Is that bug or your planed feature?
fields.summary: I installed latest Crucible and fisheye.access = md5:... appeared to public frontend

fields.description: Limit the branch dropdown to approx 200px.
fields.summary: Branch dropdown breaks page layout when branch names are massive

fields.description:
We get a global group from the Active Directory with all users who can possibly login to our applications.
But by configuring this group for potential access to the application, the licences are based on the number of users in that group, even if the many of those users never logged in to the application.
Only users who connected to the application at least once should take a licence and not all the users configured in the access groups.

We have about 3600 people in this potential user group.  We don't want to have the burden of adding every person in a group each time they want to access the application.  That's the reason we want to keep this group configured.  But at this time, only 2000 of these users are connecting and using the application.

The rest will eventually connect when the documentation and agility grows in the company.  And we would even configure the 22000 users eventually if we can only pay for the connecting users we have in all of those.
fields.summary: Users who never logged in shouldn't take a licence

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
In Crowd, there is no way to create a Personal Access Token as in Jira and Confluence. The users have to send their usernames and passwords as a Basic Authentication header.
h3. Suggested Solution
Generating a PAT and sending it as a Bearer token to use in scripts and integrating external applications with Crowd.
h3. Why This Is Important
* Using Basic Authentication doesn't provide flexibility like PAT; revoking, generating a new one without changing the user password. 
* In scripts, it's not safe to put plain or base64 encoded passwords. 
* When a user changes the passwords, all the scripts need to be changed there is a high coupling between user password and automation scripts.
fields.summary: Personal Access Token Support for Crowd

fields.description:
h3. Problem
Currently Crowd does not adhere to any standards for passwords.  This allows for creation of passwords that are not in line with known standards such as RISE and ASRG.

h3. Suggested Solution
Would like to request for a feature where, based on configuration value, new user passwords will be validated against these standards such as :

{code}
1 upper-case letter as a minimum , 1 lower-case '
letter as a minimum, 1 digit as a minimum , 1 special character -!"#$%&'()'
*+,/;:=?_@>. , 10 characters as a minimum , 25 characters as a maximum , Same'
password should not be repeated within the cycle of 12 changes.
{code}

h3. Why This Is Important
This feature will address security issues related to users creating easily guessable passwords and add a layer of security. 

h3. Workaround
None available at this point.
fields.summary: Crowd - Weak Password Policy

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

This affects both Embedded Crowd and Crowd. It relates to using an external id set to a different value than the default 'objectGUID'.

I found two scenarios in which the issue can occur:

A) The incremental sync fails with the error (found in Jira 7.13.4)
{noformat}
2021-12-07 13:19:21,189+0200 Caesium-1-1 ERROR ServiceRunner [c.a.crowd.directory.DbCachingRemoteDirectory] Incremental synchronisation for directory [ 11800 ] was unexpectedly interrupted, falling back to a full synchronisation
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: guid should be of length 32 (as encoded by getGUIDAsString)
at com.google.common.base.Preconditions.checkArgument(Preconditions.java:141)
at com.atlassian.crowd.directory.ldap.util.GuidHelper.encodeGUIDForSearch(GuidHelper.java:73)
at com.atlassian.crowd.search.ldap.filter.EqualsExternalIdFilter.encodeValue(EqualsExternalIdFilter.java:25)
at org.springframework.ldap.filter.CompareFilter.<init>(CompareFilter.java:36)
at org.springframework.ldap.filter.EqualsFilter.<init>(EqualsFilter.java:40)
at com.atlassian.crowd.search.ldap.filter.EqualsExternalIdFilter.<init>(EqualsExternalIdFilter.java:13)
at com.atlassian.crowd.search.ldap.ActiveDirectoryQueryTranslaterImpl.getStringTermEqualityFilter(ActiveDirectoryQueryTranslaterImpl.java:66) {noformat}
I could not reproduce it locally (it might fail, but in specific conditions that I am not aware of). For sure this is strictly related to MS AD configuration in which custom external ID is used.

The static code analysis for this led me to the second scenario the issue occurs. I described it in "Steps to Reproduce" section.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Setup MS AD in Crowd (or in Embedded Crowd)
 # Configure custom external id (e.g. mail)
 # Disable directory cache
 # Call the endpoint `<{{{}crowdUrl>{}}}/rest/usermanagement/1/user?key=<dir_id>:<custom_external_id_value>`

h3. Expected Results

Any GUID validation should not be performed when custom external id is set - in other words, the GUID validation should not be performed when external id is mapped from a different attribute than ‘objectGUID’.
h3. Actual Results

Http response
{noformat}
{
   "reason": "ILLEGAL_ARGUMENT",
   "message": "guid should be of length 32 (as encoded by getGUIDAsString)"
} {noformat}
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Custom external id attribute in MS AD is not handled properly

fields.description:
One of our customer's request is to disable the auto-complete function on Crowd at least while creating a new user to avoid creation of duplicate users on Crowd across all the directories. This is because the current implementation of Crowd(due to limited possibilities with the external directories) maintains username uniqueness across a given directory alone and not all the directories.

With the auto-complete ON, the admins sometimes accidentally end up creating users with similar usernames and they would want to restrict this action and let the admin(s) manually type in the username to maintain the uniqueness across directories.

Kind regards,
Venkat
fields.summary: Disable 'autocomplete' on the Create New User field on Crowd

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Currently, when admin add Azure AD as user directory in Crowd enable option to manage group locally, local groups and group membership of Azure AD will not include in XML backup. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add Azure AD to Crowd
# Enable the option to manage group locally for Azure AD
# Create local group for Azure AD
# Add Azure AD user to local group
# Generate a XML backup
# Restore it to another Crowd
# Notice that the local group created in steps 3 does not exist

h3. Expected Results
Azure AD local groups and group membership is included in XML backup

h3. Actual Results
Azure AD local groups and group membership does not include in XML backup

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Azure AD local groups and group memebrship is not included in XML backup

fields.description:
h4. Summary
It would be beneficial depending on settings to allow adjusting the pre-determined cache size of 10,000 users.

h4. Details
As per the [following documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/crowd041/configuring-caching-for-an-ldap-directory-1026041457.html] database caching for directories is preconfigured for 10,000 users and advises not to cache if you have more than that.
{quote}
*Be aware of the optimal number of users.* We have optimized the database caching for directories containing approximately 10 000 (ten thousand) users. If your directory is significantly larger, the new caching may not be as beneficial. For really large user bases, we recommend that you leave the caching disabled.
{quote}

h4. Notes
* For example with local groups enabled, it's not possible to disable caching so if you have more than 10,000 users you suffer extreme performance issues.
** Eg; 80,000 users in a directory will synch up to 10,000 within minutes or an hr. The remaining 70,000, whilst eventually successful can take a full week to complete.

This makes it very hard to update user attributes such as usernames without a week long task or completely recreating their entire LDAP structure which is complicated with many directories and filers.

* Please consider adding an option to adjust the default 10,000 user database cache especially when local groups are also enabled.
fields.summary: Add option to adjust the database caching size from 10000 users per directory

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Importing users from one internal directory to the other, using the directory importer, ignores custom attributes.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create internal directory.
 # Create a user on this directory.
 # Add a custom attribute to that user.
 # Create a second internal directory.
 # Using directory importer, import the user of the first directory to the second.

h3. Expected Results

The custom attributes of the user will be transferred to the user entry created on the second directory.
h3. Actual Results

The custom attributes are missing.
h3. Workaround

Running the following query should create the missing custom attributes:
{code:java}
insert into cwd_user_attribute (id, user_id, directory_id, attribute_name, attribute_value, attribute_lower_value, attribute_numeric_value)
select (select max(id) from cwd_user_attribute) + row_number() over (order by dst_user_id) as dst_id, dst_user_id, dst_directory_id, attribute.attribute_name, attribute.attribute_value, attribute.attribute_lower_value, attribute.attribute_numeric_value
from
   (
       select src.id as src_user_id, dst.id as dst_user_id, dst.directory_id as dst_directory_id
       from cwd_user as src, cwd_user as dst
       where src.directory_id = <id-of-source-directory>
       and dst.directory_id = <id-of-target-directory>
       and src.lower_user_name = dst.lower_user_name) as mapping,
   cwd_user_attribute as attribute
where attribute.user_id = mapping.src_user_id
and attribute.attribute_name not in (select attribute_name from cwd_user_attribute where user_id = dst_user_id); {code}
fields.summary: Importing users with the directory importer ignores custom attributes

fields.description:
Currently [Centralized license visibility|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1220745/centralized-license-visibility] only supports Jira Data Center 7.6.0 - 8.14.1,
Bitbucket Data Center 5.4.0 - 7.14.1 
• The most recent version of Confluence 7.14.1 is working as expected.

Please update the plugin to support all of the applicable applications.
fields.summary: Update Centralised license visibility for Jira & Bitbucket

fields.description:
It would be great if we can use Plan your upgrade in an offline environment. Like generate a JSON/XML with the current version and settings of Crowd+ plugins.

Recommend versions to use, including links to the latest version of plugins. But also inform administrators about turned off plugins which breaks upgrading the application. Or settings which can be optimized.
fields.summary: As a Crowd admin I would like to have an upgrade plan feature

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Issue related to the paths in REST API docs for the recent Crowd versions.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Step 1: go to REST API docs of the affected version -[https://docs.atlassian.com/atlassian-crowd/4.4.0/REST/]
 # Step 2: review REST endpoints

h3. Expected Results
 * paths should start with `/rest/admin/1.0` or `/rest/usermanagement/1` or `/rest/directorymanagement/1`
 * example: GET /rest/admin/1.0/samlconfig

see [https://docs.atlassian.com/atlassian-crowd/4.3.0/REST/]
h3. Actual Results
 * endpoint paths are not valid - missing prefixes
 * example: GET /rest/samlconfig

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Paths in REST API docs are invalid

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When adding a new User Directory, an initial sync will halt if a duplicated user is found. The process has to be repeated over and over again if multiple duplicate users exist.

h3. Suggested Solution
Create a "Dry-Run" that allows the entire sync to complete and produce a report of collisions.
 
h3. Workaround 
Resolve duplicated users one at a time.
fields.summary: Identify duplicate users via "dry-run" on User Directory sync

fields.description:
h3. Problem

When a user that is not an admin has more than 100 groups to administer, they can only see the first 100, the pagination links are grayed out and they can't go over pages. They can search by the group name though.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Add a non-admin user as administrator for more than 100 groups, log with that user and try to see all the groups at the Groups screen.
h3. Expected Results

_The user should be able to see all the groups on the page and go to the next page if the groups don't fit on the screen._
h3. Actual Results

_The user can see just the first 100 groups, and can not go to the next page to continue through the list._

_!grouplistcount.png|width=600,height=550!_
_!groupnotfound on the list.png|width=600,height=550!_
_!groupsearch.png|width=600,height=550!_

h3. Workaround

_The user can search by the group name._

 
h3.
fields.summary: Grouplevel admin page not paginating when groups to administer are over 100

fields.description: In a multi-IDP setup, it would be desirable for user email to be pre populated on an existing SAML login page (by reading a URL parameter) so that the user is freed from the decision/action of picking the correct IDP.
fields.summary: Pre-populate an email address on a Crowd SAML login page via URL parameters

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If user have nested group setup in lower position directory and the same group name exist in the top directory without nested, the nested membership will not be synced.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create directory1
** Create a user name bob in directory1
** Create 2 group with name *group1*, *group3*
** Add bob to be a member of *group3*
# Create directory2 and enable nested group
** Create a user name t1 in directory2
** Create 3 group with name *group1*, *group2*, *group3*
** Add t1 to group3
** Add group3 to be a member of group2
** Add group2 to be a member of group1
# Create a application to Confluence
# In the application, make sure the directory1 is at the top position
# Ensure the aggregation option is disable
# Add Crowd as user directory in Confluence and perform sync (enable nested group)
(i) Can review the following video as well for more details
 [^Recording #10.mp4] 

h3. Expected Results
Bob will have the following membership
* group3

t1 will have the following membership
* group1
* group2
* group3

h3. Actual Results
Bob will have the following membership
* group3

t1 will have the following membership
* group3
The nested group membership is not synced as the group name exist in top directory

h3. Workaround
The workaround is to either enable the aggregation feature or switch the position of the user directory.
PS: if you switch the user directory position to make directory2 on top and disable the aggregation feature. User from the lower directory that is a member of a child group will auto get the membership of nested group as well from the top directory
E.g Result
Same setup as above steps but we switch the directory position to following:
# directory2
# directory1

Bob will have the following membership
* group1
* group2
* group3

t1 will have the following membership
* group1
* group2
* group3
fields.summary: Nested membership is not respected if the same group name exsist in top user directory

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If a group has an underscore in it's name such as "group_1", "confluence_group", "jira_group" group filtering fails in Audit Logs as these groups are not presented as filter options in the group filter drop down.

Note that filtering will break right after the underscore. For example, if we try to filter "group_", group_1 will be returned. However, if we try to filter, "group_1", nothing returns. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create groups with underscores such as "group_1", "confluence_group", "jira_group"
 # Head over to *Audit Logs*
 # Under the groups drop down search for the above groups. 

h3. Expected Results

The groups are returned regardless of the characters in the group
h3. Actual Results

Up to and including the underscore the group(s) will be returned:
 !Screenshot 2021-10-11 at 18.21.13.png|width=940,height=92!

As soon as we include the first character after the underscore to the search string, the group(s) are not returned.

!Screenshot 2021-10-11 at 18.21.21.png|width=599,height=59!
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Groups with underscore "_" character cannot be filtered using the Audit Log group filters

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When a directory in Crowd has read/write permissions, we can create users/groups in Crowd and have it synchronized to the external directory (e.g. AD).

When a group is created in Crowd, the {{sAMAccountName}} is not specified during group creation and causes AD to fill it up with a bunch of random characters. For example:
{code:java}
sAMAccountName: $1B99D3F7-AE3F57856444E64{code}
h3. Suggestion

Assign the {{sAMAccountName}} attribute of the group object to the group name ({{cn}}).
fields.summary: Specify the sAMAccountName when a group is created in Crowd and synchronised to AD

fields.description:
I just noticed that  when a table to too wide to be fit into the screen, the horizontal scroll bar (to pan across the table) is provided at the very bottom of that table.

What this means is, if the table has many rows the user needs to constantly scroll up and down to reach the horizontal scroll bar and then scroll up again to see what's on columns on the right.

'

!image-2021-10-06-11-55-19-067.png!
fields.summary: Scroll bar on tables structures

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using command line, REST API endpoints may fail with an "Application failed to authenticate" error.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

The following REST API calls (at least) fail to be executed:
{code:java}
fkraemer@C02ZX4MTMD6N ~ % curl -u fkraemer -X GET "http://localhost:8095/crowd/rest/usermanagement/1/user/attribute?username=crowd1"
Enter host password for user 'fkraemer':
Application failed to authenticate
fkraemer@C02ZX4MTMD6N ~ % curl -u fkraemer -X PUT -d '{"value":"newpwd"}' "http://localhost:8095/crowd/rest/usermanagement/1/user/password?username=crowd1"
Enter host password for user 'fkraemer':
Application failed to authenticate
fkraemer@C02ZX4MTMD6N ~ %
{code}
*Notes:*
 * Authentication of {{fkraemer}} works directly in the browser.
 * The base URL {{[http://localhost:8095/crowd]}} is correct.
 * The user {{fkraemer}} is a local Crowd administrator.
 * The user {{crowd1}} is a local Crowd regular user.

h3. Expected Results

Authentication works and the REST API call is executed successfully.
h3. Actual Results

Authentication fails and the REST API call is not executed.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: REST API authentication fails

fields.description: Currently, Crowd only offers directory-level password expiry configuration. In some cases, admins need a single local user with a 90 day password expiration.
fields.summary: Set 90-day password expiration for single user

fields.description:
As a Crowd administrator, I am not always the administrator for the LDAP environment but I need to retain user records with an LDAP connector user directory for business purposes. I would like to have an option to retain user records for auditing purposes instead of having them automatically deleted on the next LDAP sync.

h2. Workaround

Currently, a workaround is not available in the product directly for LDAP connectors but you can use a Delegated LDAP Authentication user directory to retain user records.

This may not work for all use cases, but you can also manually copy users over to the Crowd Internal Directory and deactivate them so that their records are maintained. If you don't have control or visibility on when users are added/deleted in LDAP, though, you should engage with your LDAP administration team for coordination purposes to ensure that your business processes are being respected as a Crowd administrator.
fields.summary: Allow configuration for LDAP connectors to retain users in Crowd when they are deleted in LDAP

fields.description:
The current section *Set up the shared directory* could be more detailed to avoid confusion. Misinterpreting this section can lead to setting up the shared folder incorrectly, which causes issues like this:

* https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CROWDKB/Logging+into+Crowd+results+in+a+blank+screen

This is a tricky problem to detect as there are no clear indications that those errors can interfere with the log-in process. Maybe the doc could be more detailed on the steps and bring a reference of what should and should not be shared between nodes like in the KB.
fields.summary: Improve Crowd DC installation doc

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

As part of [KRAK-3358|https://bulldog.internal.atlassian.com/browse/KRAK-3358] group membership sync is ignored in the Crowd logic for performance reasons with embedded Crowd 4.2.2+.

h3. Expected Results
The UI should notify the user that group membership sync is being ignored because nested groups are enabled.
fields.summary: "every time the user logs in" Group Membership setting ignored when Nest Groups enabled

fields.description:
We would like to be able to:
 * Create Applications
 * Create Application - > Directory Mapping
 * Update Application - > Directory Mapping - > Allowed Groups
 * Update Application - > Directory Mapping - > Allowed Operations


Using a combination of documented (*crowd-rest-admin*) and undocumented (*crowd-rest-application-management*) modules the first three are possible, but the last item is not.

Please provide a RESTful API using JSON bindings that would allow for a complete Application API.
fields.summary: Provide REST API to manage Applications

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Valid CSV files fail to import using the CSV importer.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to the Crowd [CSV importer|https://confluence.atlassian.com/crowd/importing-users-from-csv-files-64454760.html]
 # Upload a valid CSV file. You also use the [example user's CSV|https://confluence.atlassian.com/crowd/files/64454760/65634312/1/1185163637359/example_users_file.csv] from the above document.
# Import the file and notice it fails to be read.

All permissions have been verified on the import files as well.

h3. Expected Results
The file is read and the CSV procesdded.

h3. Actual Results

The below exception is thrown in the application logs:
{noformat}The fil "<file path"> cannot be found or read.{noformat}

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.

If CSV importing is a requirement, you must downgrade to Crowd 4.2.4 to allow for CSV importing.
fields.summary: CSV import fails with valid CSV files

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

As a customer, I would like additional confidence that future versions of Crowd are regression tested using the latest compatible version(s) of [Microsoft's SQL Server JDBC driver|https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/sql/connect/jdbc/download-microsoft-jdbc-driver-for-sql-server?view=sql-server-ver15] against Crowd [supported platforms|https://confluence.atlassian.com/crowd/supported-platforms-191851.html] of Microsoft SQL Server.
fields.summary: Test Crowd with compatible version of Microsoft's SQL Server JDBC driver

fields.description:
h4. Information
Based on the latest [official Crowd REST API documentation|https://docs.atlassian.com/atlassian-crowd/4.3.5/REST/#admin/1.0/application] (4.3.5 as of now), Crowd has resource point for application: *{{admin/1.0/application}}*.

But this resource point has only endpoints for getting information or updating existing application definitions.

h4. Suggested Solution
Add an endpoint for provisioning applications from REST API. This can help to create automation for integrating Crowd with other applications.
fields.summary: Add the ability to create application definition via REST API

fields.description: As a feature request and in a similar manner to Bitbucket, it would be nice to be able to pre-seed *all* (not just JDBC connection details) of Crowd's configurations prior to deployment. This would mean that manual configuration post install would not be necessary. This would be especially useful for the AWS QuickStarts including the up and coming K8s Helm Charts.
fields.summary: Pre-seed Crowd deployment with required configuration

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The Centralized License Visibility plugin ([https://marketplace.atlassian.com/manage/apps/1220745)] does not start up in Bitbucket standalone 7.15.0. The issue does not occur on older versions and most likely requires an external database (Postgres and SQL Server are confirmed so far)
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install Centralized License Visibility plugin in Bitbucket 7.15

h3. Expected Results

The plugin starts up
h3. Actual Results

The below exception is seen in the Bitbucket logs:
{noformat}
2021-08-02 13:11:42,197 ERROR [http-nio-7990-exec-1] admin @MJ8RO9x791x88x0 1po1uo1 127.0.0.1 "PUT /rest/plugins/1.0/com.atlassian.plugins.panopticon-key HTTP/1.1" c.a.p.o.f.Unreco

gnizedModuleDescriptorServiceTrackerCustomizer Unable to transform com.atlassian.plugins.panopticon:ao-module into actual plugin module using factory com.atlassian.activeobjects.pl

ugin.ActiveObjectsModuleDescriptorFactory@7aedef21

com.atlassian.activeobjects.ActiveObjectsPluginException: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: com.atlassian.plugins.license.model.LicensedUserAO

        at com.atlassian.activeobjects.plugin.ActiveObjectModuleDescriptor.getEntityClass(ActiveObjectModuleDescriptor.java:192)

        at com.atlassian.activeobjects.plugin.ActiveObjectModuleDescriptor.access$200(ActiveObjectModuleDescriptor.java:43)

        at com.atlassian.activeobjects.plugin.ActiveObjectModuleDescriptor$4.apply(ActiveObjectModuleDescriptor.java:183)

        at com.atlassian.activeobjects.plugin.ActiveObjectModuleDescriptor$4.apply(ActiveObjectModuleDescriptor.java:181)

        at com.google.common.collect.Iterators$6.transform(Iterators.java:785)

        at com.google.common.collect.TransformedIterator.next(TransformedIterator.java:47)

        at com.google.common.collect.Iterators.addAll(Iterators.java:358)

        at com.google.common.collect.Sets.newHashSet(Sets.java:276)

        at com.google.common.collect.Sets.newHashSet(Sets.java:259)

        at com.atlassian.activeobjects.plugin.ActiveObjectModuleDescriptor.getEntities(ActiveObjectModuleDescriptor.java:181)

        at com.atlassian.activeobjects.plugin.ActiveObjectModuleDescriptor.init(ActiveObjectModuleDescriptor.java:76)

        at org.osgi.util.tracker.ServiceTracker$Tracked.customizerAdding(ServiceTracker.java:941)

        at org.osgi.util.tracker.ServiceTracker$Tracked.customizerAdding(ServiceTracker.java:870)

        at org.osgi.util.tracker.AbstractTracked.trackAdding(AbstractTracked.java:256)

        at org.osgi.util.tracker.AbstractTracked.trackInitial(AbstractTracked.java:183)

        at org.osgi.util.tracker.ServiceTracker.open(ServiceTracker.java:318)

        at org.osgi.util.tracker.ServiceTracker.open(ServiceTracker.java:261)

        at com.atlassian.plugin.impl.AbstractPlugin.enable(AbstractPlugin.java:252)

        at com.atlassian.plugin.manager.PluginEnabler.actualEnable(PluginEnabler.java:120)

... 
Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: com.atlassian.plugins.license.model.LicensedUserAO

        at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(URLClassLoader.java:382)

        at com.atlassian.activeobjects.plugin.ActiveObjectModuleDescriptor.getEntityClass(ActiveObjectModuleDescriptor.java:190)

        ... 78 common frames omitted
 {noformat}
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Centralized license visibility plugin is not compatible with Bitbucket 7.15

fields.description:
h3. Problem

When Crowd loses connectivity with LDAP, whenever an authentication call is done by an application to Crowd and goes to that delegated LDAP, will have an invalid credentials error happening.

h3. Environment
Crowd 4.2.3
Delegated LDAP
Other LDAP directories connected
An application connected to Crowd

h3. Steps to Reproduce

Have an application using Crowd for authentication.
Have crowd using a delegated LDAP and other directories available 
Have the connection between Crowd and the delegated LDAP lost or broken
Have an authentication request coming from the application connected to the crowd for a user present on the delegated LDAP
The crowd will try to authenticate against the delegated LDAP, after identifying the unavailability, will start to try it against all others directories, spamming "invalid credentials"
Which will trigger captcha on the applications of origin.

h3. Expected Results
Have crowd return authentication unavailable at the time or time out of the request.

h3. Actual Results

Try to authenticate on any of the directories and cache of Crowd and reply with invalid credentials, triggering captcha and locking the account on connected applications.
{noformat}
2021-07-19 17:11:22,534 http-nio-8300-exec-58 ERROR [crowd.manager.application.ApplicationServiceGeneric] Directory 'LDAP' is not functional during authentication of 'USER'. Skipped.
2021-07-19 17:11:22,563 http-nio-8300-exec-58 INFO [crowd.manager.application.ApplicationServiceGeneric] Invalid credentials for user USER in directory Internal Crowd, aborting
2021-07-19 17:11:24,548 http-nio-8300-exec-32 ERROR [crowd.manager.application.ApplicationServiceGeneric] Directory 'LDAP' is not functional during authentication of 'USER'. Skipped.
2021-07-19 17:11:24,580 http-nio-8300-exec-32 INFO [crowd.manager.application.ApplicationServiceGeneric] Invalid credentials for user USER in directory Internal Crowd, aborting
2021-07-19 17:11:27,504 https-jsse-nio-8301-exec-15 ERROR [crowd.manager.application.ApplicationServiceGeneric] Directory 'LDAP' is not functional during authentication of 'USER'. Skipped.
2021-07-19 17:11:27,537 https-jsse-nio-8301-exec-15 INFO [crowd.manager.application.ApplicationServiceGeneric] Invalid credentials for user USER in directory Internal Crowd, aborting
2021-07-19 17:11:28,036 http-nio-8300-exec-43 ERROR [crowd.manager.application.ApplicationServiceGeneric] Directory 'LDAP' is not functional during authentication of 'USER'. Skipped.
{noformat}

h3. Workaround
Have captcha disabled on the application connected to crowd or disable all of the automation from generating authentication requests during the time frame where the LDAP is not available.
fields.summary: Crowd throws invalid credentials when not able to access delegated LDAP

fields.description: It would be useful for large companies who are not able to upgrade often to have LTS releases of Crowd where major big fixes can be backported.
fields.summary: LTS releases for Crowd

fields.description:
h3. Problem definition 
[Crowd - Oracle|https://confluence.atlassian.com/crowd/oracle-32243789.html] and [Supported Platforms|https://confluence.atlassian.com/crowd/supported-platforms-191851.html] documentation does not explicitly mention if the Oracle multitenant mode (or Container Database aka CDB) is supported or not and how to configure it.

h3. Suggestion
Support the configuration and include the information above in the Supported Platforms and Database configuration documentation
fields.summary: Crowd with Oracle multitenant mode support

fields.description: tt
fields.summary: tt

fields.description:
When using MSSQL 2019, we are unable to create a support zip on Crowd 4.3.0

Crowd 4.3.0 supports the MSSQL 2019 database, based on the supported platforms:
* [Crowd 4.3 supported platforms|https://confluence.atlassian.com/crowd/supported-platforms-191851.html]

h3. Expected results

Crowd successfully creates a support zip.

h3. Observed behavior

An error is returned on Crowd UI per the screenshot below:
!supportzip_bug_crowd.png|thumbnail!

Inside the logs, we can see the following:
{code}
2021-07-06 17:20:03,348 http-nio-8095-exec-13 ERROR [common.error.jersey.ThrowableExceptionMapper] Uncaught exception thrown by REST service: bundle [com.atlassian.troubleshooting.plugin-crowd]
com.atlassian.activeobjects.internal.ActiveObjectsInitException: bundle [com.atlassian.troubleshooting.plugin-crowd]
	at com.atlassian.activeobjects.osgi.TenantAwareActiveObjects$1$1$1.call(TenantAwareActiveObjects.java:95)
	at com.atlassian.activeobjects.osgi.TenantAwareActiveObjects$1$1$1.call(TenantAwareActiveObjects.java:86)
	at com.atlassian.sal.core.executor.ThreadLocalDelegateCallable.call(ThreadLocalDelegateCallable.java:38)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:266)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1149)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:624)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:748)
Caused by: com.atlassian.activeobjects.internal.DatabaseProviderNotFoundException: Could not find database provider for data source which uses JDBC driver <jTDS Type 4 JDBC Driver for MS SQL Server and Sybase>
{code}

h3. Workaround

There are no workarounds available yet. 

If necessary to grab the Crowd logs for troubleshooting purposes, they will be located on the *Crowd_data/logs* folder.
fields.summary: Unable to create support zip in Crowd when using MSSQL 2019

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The CSV import screen should list the full path from which the files can be imported. However the path is missing
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to the Import CSV screen

h3. Expected Results

The screen should list the full path to the import files directory.
h3. Actual Results

The path is missing from the header, resulting in broken text

> The CSV files for the import must be placed within the directory
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: The CSV import screen does not list the correct import directory
